&  TV Food  &  Drink Music  &  Nightlife Shopping Expand Middlesbrough FC Sport Expand Nostalgia Business Food  &  Drink Special Features Christmas Home Sport Football Middlesbrough FC Sport The scene at the Riverside Stadium this morning as Leeds cancel Middlesbrough pre-match press conference Boro remain determined for do everything possible to get Friday night's game to go ahead This is a modal window. Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window. End of dialog window. This is a modal window. This modal can be closed by pressing the Escape key or activating the close button. This is a modal window. This modal can be closed by pressing the Escape key or activating the close button. Middlesbrough staff were out at 7.30am this morning attempting to clear some of the paths surrounding the snow-covered Riverside. Groundsmen spent the entire day yesterday working on the Riverside pitch in a bid to ensure it ' s ready for Friday night ' s game against Leeds United. But it ' s not the pitch that will be the issue as  Boro  chiefs meet with key council officials, transport bosses and the police for talks today. Rather, top of the agenda will be the safety of supporters as they make their way to the Riverside, with surrounding areas extremely treacherous after another night of heavy snowfall. Boro yesterday  assured fans they were  " working hard "  to ensure Friday ' s game beats the Beast from the East and staff were pictured out trying to clear the car park and the immediate surrounding areas. Boro remain determined to get the green light on the game. But the approach roads and driving conditions across Teesside are beyond club control and could present a bigger problem. Leeds United this morning cancelled Paul Heckingbottom ' s pre-match press conference that was due to take place at dinnertime. Tony Pulis, however, was due to speak to the press as planned at Rockliffe this morning. The Boro boss is obviously preparing as usual for the game to go ahead and the Boro squad trained as normal at Hurworth yesterday. An amber weather warning remains in place on Teesside today with more snow forecast throughout the day and tonight.
